== Arguments ==

To run proxyshark, simply run the Python script _proxyshark.py_. The default configuration will start the interactive [Usage#Command-line_interface command-line interface] but you can run the script with several command-line arguments:

 ==== `-h | --help` ====

 Print a help message describing the available command-line arguments.

 ==== `-v | --verbose` ====

 Print debugging information to the standard error output.

 ==== `-q | --queue-num <queue-num>` ====

 Set the queue number to listen.

 ==== `-t | --tshark-binary <tshark-binary>` ====

 Set the path to the _tshark_ binary.

 ==== `-w | --web-ui` ====

 Enable the web-based user interface. The default choice enables the command-line interface.

 ==== `-a | --bind-address <bind-address>` ====

 Set the bind address of the web server.

 ==== `-p | --port <port>` ====

 Set the listening port of the web server.
